title: Easeout Weekly #22
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![Italic font](/images/uploads/italic.png) [How to Italicize Text](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-italicize-text/) HTML and CSS offer us the ability to *italicize* text. This article compares the 5 different ways we can go about it. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-italicize-text/)
![Creative Wellness Article Card](/images/uploads/good-talk-thoughts-feelings-creative-wellness.png) [It’s Good To Talk: Thoughts And Feelings On Creative Wellness](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/thoughts-feelings-creative-wellness/) With so much pressure to be our best selves and use every waking moment to develop skills, it’s easy to lose track of our own wellbeing. Self-improvement and commitment to your craft are great — but only if you find the right balance. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/thoughts-feelings-creative-wellness/)
![Svelte Logo](/images/uploads/svelte-images.png) [Lazy Loading Images in Svelte](https://css-tricks.com/lazy-loading-images-in-svelte/) This neat tutorial shows us how to use the Intersection Observer API alongside the `onLoad` event, to lazy load images with the Svelte JavaScript framework. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/lazy-loading-images-in-svelte/)
![React Performance Metrics](/images/uploads/react-devtools-profiler-methods-performance-react-apps.png) [Methods Of Improving And Optimizing Performance In React Apps](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/methods-performance-react-apps/) In this tutorial, we'll learn about the various methods of optimizing performance in React applications, and also the features of React that we can use to improve performance. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/methods-performance-react-apps/)
![JAMStack Snail](/images/uploads/jamstack-snail.png) [Make Jamstack Slow? Challenge Accepted](https://css-tricks.com/make-jamstack-slow-challenge-accepted/) Jamstack can be fast — really *fast* — but you have to make the right choices. Let’s see if we can spot some of the poor decisions that can lead to a “slow” Jamstack site. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/make-jamstack-slow-challenge-accepted/)
![Stimulus.js Logo](/images/uploads/stimulus-js.png) [An Introduction To Stimulus.js](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/introduction-stimulusjs/) In this article, we look at Stimulus, a modest JavaScript framework that compliments your existing HTML. And we'll see why it’s a useful tool to have in your front-end backpack. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/introduction-stimulusjs/)
![Smashing Podcast Episode 20](/images/uploads/smashing-podcast-episode-20.png) [Smashing Podcast Episode 20 With Marcy Sutton: What Is Gatsby?](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/smashing-podcast-episode-20/) We’re talking about Gatsby. What is it and how does it fit into your web development stack? Drew McLellan talks to expert Marcy Sutton to find out. [Listen up ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/smashing-podcast-episode-20/)
![Mobile redesign article card](/images/uploads/redesigning-mobile-app.png) [Is Redesigning Your Mobile App A Bad Idea?](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/redesigning-mobile-app/) A redesign should be done for the right reasons! This article takes a look at some mistakes made and the lessons we can extract from them. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/redesigning-mobile-app/)
![Crowdfunding Features Doc](/images/uploads/crowdfunding-features.png) [Crowdfunding Web Platform Features With Open Prioritization](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/crowdfunding-web-platform-features-open-prioritization/) Rachel Andrew takes a look at a new effort to crowdfund the costs of implementing browser features. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/crowdfunding-web-platform-features-open-prioritization/)
![Frontend Masters and Gatsby Logos](/images/uploads/fem-gatsby.png) [My Long Journey to a Decoupled WordPress Gatsby Site](https://css-tricks.com/my-long-journey-to-a-decoupled-wordpress-gatsby-site/) A wonderful article from Ganesh Dahal, detailing the resources he used while learning web development coming from a scientific background. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/my-long-journey-to-a-decoupled-wordpress-gatsby-site/)
![React Use Fetch](/images/uploads/use-fetch.png) [How To Create A Custom React Hook To Fetch And Cache Data](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/custom-react-hook-fetch-cache-data/) This tutorial introduces React Hooks, detailing how you can build a custom hook that will fetch and cache data for you. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/custom-react-hook-fetch-cache-data/)
![ShopTalk Logo](/images/uploads/shoptalk.png) [Spinning Down Projects, Educating the Back-End Team, and Choosing Old Tech](https://shoptalkshow.com/421/) A look at how and when to spin down old projects, sun setting GitHub repos, and forums. Also how to educate and bring along the back-end team with tech, and when you should stick with old tech instead of the new hotness. [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/421/)

short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
